thread.title: Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game
thread.title_full: Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game

title: Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game Alex Ovechkin spoke to the media on Wednesday morning an admitted that he missed Tuesday's game because of an alarm clock fail. Post to Facebook Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game Alex Ovechkin spoke to the media on Wednesday morning an admitted that he missed Tuesday's game because of an alarm clock fail.  //on.wusa9.com/1Lu3eEu   Join the Conversation To   Alarm clock fail caused Alex Ovechkin to miss Tuesday's game Sam C. LaPaille, WUSA9 12:59 p.m. EDT October 14, 2015 Sep 30, 2015; Raleigh, NC, USA; Washington Capitals forward Alex Ovechkin (8) looks on before the game against the Carolina Hurricanes at PNC Arena. The Carolina Hurricanes defeated the Washington Capitals 4-3 in a shoot out. Mandatory Credit: James Guillory-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: James Guillory, James Guillory-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON (WUSA9) -- Alex Ovechkin missed Tuesday night's game against the San Jose Sharks for a reason that most people could relate to. 
Ovechkin admitted to the media on Wednesday that he missed Tuesday's morning skate because he had his alarm set for "p.m." instead of "a.m." , causing him to be late for practice and subsequently pulled from Tuesday's lineup. Alex Ovechkin missed morning skate yesterday because he set his alarm for p.m. instead of a.m. Because he missed practice, couldn't play. â€” Isabelle Khurshudyan (@ikhurshudyan) October 14, 2015 
By missing practice, Barry Trotz was forced to pull his star winger from the lineup as per team rules. 
When asked how he felt about missing the San Jose game, Ovechkin responded as only Alex Ovechkin could. 
"It was suck." 
Trotz did note that Ovechkin's alarm blunder was "an honest mistake." 
Ovechkin participated in Wednesday's morning skate and is fully-expected to be back in the lineup on Thursday night when the defending Stanley Cup champion Chicago Blackhawks come into town.
